required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Keratometric Tear Breakup Time and Fluorescein Tear Breakup Time
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Keratometric Tear Break Up Time (KTBUT) to Fluorescein Tear Break Up Time (FTBUT)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the research is to determine if putting fluorescein onto the eye (most common test done for dry eye syndrome) is an accurate way to measure dry eye symptoms. The investigators can avoid placing any foreign substance into the eye by using a manual keratometer. Therefore, the investigators want to compare the measurements of tear breakup time using fluorescein with using a novel method, a manual keratometer and then compare these measurements to a validated dry eye symptoms questionnaire. All qualifying patients who were scheduled in the Jones Eye Institute Clinics for a complete eye exam were offered information about the study and invited to participate. Participants were recruited from February 29, 2009 to April 14, 2009.Participants who did not meet the study protocol's inclusion and exclusion criteria were not included the study or study data analysis. All subjects eyes were measured for KTBUT and FTBUT.

detailed_description.textblock: This is an observational study to measure the difference between Keratometric Tear Break Up Time (KTBUT) and Fluorescein Tear Break Up Time (FTBUT). All qualified study participants had their eyes measured for tear break up time measured with a keratometer and with fluorescein dye. In this study, we compare the use of the most common method, fluorescein dye, to measure tear break up time to a novel method, a keratometer, to measure tear break up time. Using the keratometer avoids instilling fluorescein dye into the tear film and not altering the tear film's physiologic environment.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference Between Keratometric Tear Break Up Time (KTBUT) and Fluorescein Tear Break Up Time (FTBUT)
primary_outcome.description: This outcome measures the difference in tear break up time using a keratometer and fluorescein dye.

secondary_outcome.description: The Ocular Surface Disease Index (OSDI) is a validated 12-item questionnaire used in dry eye studies. The OSDI Scale ranges from 0= Normal to 100= Severe. Subcategories include problems--all of the time, most of the time, half of the time,and none of the time.

arm_group.description: These are the study participants whose tear break up times were measured with a keratometer.
These are the study participants whose tear break up times were measured with with fluorescein dye.

study_pop.textblock: Patients from the Jones Eye Clinic, Department of Ophthalmology, University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- An adult, between ages 18-99
- An adult who is able to understand study instructions
Exclusion Criteria:
- An adult with corneal pathology that prevents accurate assessment of keratometric or fluorescein tear break up time.
- An adult with an allergy to fluorescein, a very common eye dye that detects defects in the cornea.
- The inability to answer questions on your own.

facility.name: Jones Eye Institute, University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences

responsible_party.organization: Department of Ophthalmology, University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences

participant_flow.recruitment_details: All qualifying patients who were scheduled in the Jones Eye Institute Clinics for a complete eye exam were offered information about the study and invited to participate. Participants were recruited from February 29, 2009 to April 14, 2009.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants who did not meet the study protocol's inclusion and exclusion criteria were not included the study or study data analysis. All subjects eyes were measured for first for KTBUT and second for FTBUT. Each measurement occured three times in each eye and the results were recorded in seconds during their office visit and averaged.

group.title: All Study Participants
group.description: These are the total number of study participants whose tear break up times were measured with a keratometer (KTBUT) and fluorescein dye (FTBUT). Both KTBUT and FTBUT were measured in all study participants.

participants_list.participants: There were 26 participants whose eyes were measured in the KTBUT group.
There were 26 participants in this group. One person was excluded be causes of no ocular history.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: One person had no ocular history

group.title: All Study Participants
group.description: These are the total number of study participants whose tear break up times were measured with a keratometer (KTBUT) and fluorescein dye (FTBUT). All study participants participated in both the KTBUT Study Arm and the FTBUT Study Arm.

outcome.title: Difference Between Keratometric Tear Break Up Time (KTBUT) and Fluorescein Tear Break Up Time (FTBUT)
outcome.description: This outcome measures the difference in tear break up time using a keratometer and fluorescein dye.
outcome.population: The number of participants for analysis was determined if each participant met all of the study protocol's inclusion and exclusion criteria. KTBUT and FTBUT were measured on all study participants.

measure.title: Difference Between Keratometric Tear Break Up Time (KTBUT) and Fluorescein Tear Break Up Time (FTBUT)
measure.description: This outcome measures the difference in tear break up time using a keratometer and fluorescein dye.
measure.population: The number of participants for analysis was determined if each participant met all of the study protocol's inclusion and exclusion criteria. KTBUT and FTBUT were measured on all study participants.

analysis.groups_desc: The paired T-test was used to compare mean KTBUT and mean FTBUT.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: This was a pilot study. Therefore, no formal power analyses were performed.

outcome.title: Ocular Surface Disease Index (OSDI) Questionnaire
outcome.description: The Ocular Surface Disease Index (OSDI) is a validated 12-item questionnaire used in dry eye studies. The OSDI Scale ranges from 0= Normal to 100= Severe. Subcategories include problems--all of the time, most of the time, half of the time,and none of the time.
outcome.population: By comparing the KTBUT and the FTBUT to the Ocular Surface Disease Index (OSDI) questionnaire score of each participant, we will be able to evaluate the difference in tear break up time using these items. The OSDI was given once before the participant's KTBUT and FTBUT was measured.

measure.title: Ocular Surface Disease Index (OSDI) Questionnaire
measure.description: The Ocular Surface Disease Index (OSDI) is a validated 12-item questionnaire used in dry eye studies. The OSDI Scale ranges from 0= Normal to 100= Severe. Subcategories include problems--all of the time, most of the time, half of the time,and none of the time.
measure.population: By comparing the KTBUT and the FTBUT to the Ocular Surface Disease Index (OSDI) questionnaire score of each participant, we will be able to evaluate the difference in tear break up time using these items. The OSDI was given once before the participant's KTBUT and FTBUT was measured.

analysis.groups_desc: A correlation was performed between ODSI questionnaire results and each participant's KTBUT.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The analysis will evaluate the association between OSDI with KTBUT.

analysis.groups_desc: A correlation was performed between ODSI questionnaire results and each participant's FTBUT.

reported_events.desc: The number of participants at risk were 0. Serious and/or other [non-serious] adverse events were not collected or assessed. The study only required subjects to participate one time. There were not any follow-up visits.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

point_of_contact.organization: University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences
